dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 54 (76b 4x4 0x6) SR: 71.05

dismissalComment.html: gone this time. Mustafizur strikes. It was going to be the last ball of his spell, but Mendis still sticks to an attempted dab to third man. It's another offcutter, but this one snicks the bat on its way to the keeper. Was a quality fifty from Mendis, but has got out at an inopportune moment. Good discipline from Mustafizur

dismissalText.long: c Taskin Ahmed b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Taskin Ahmed b Mashrafe Mortaza 52 (40b 4x4 1x6) SR: 130

dismissalComment.html: and taken by short fine leg. Not sure he needed to do that, especially with his power. It's a good full delivery way outside off, Thisara gets right across and scoops the ball to short fine leg. End of a superb innings through.

dismissalText.long: c Mahmudullah b Mehidy Hasan Miraz
dismissalText.commentary: Danushka Gunathilaka c Mahmudullah b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 34 (38b 3x4 1x6) SR: 89.47

dismissalComment.html: and gone! Gunathilaka chips his wicket away. He was looking so good. So so good. Plenty of flight outside off, dips late on Gunathilaka, and he can't keep his drive down. Maybe undone by the slowness in the surface. A simple catch for Mahmudullah. Good stuff from Mehedi, kept bowling it full.

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga b Taskin Ahmed 35 (35b 5x4 1x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: goes straight through! Tharanga falls. Fullish delivery around leg, Tharanga is beaten for pace as he plays around the delivery. The ball sneaks through bat and pad and hits middle stump. Another good delivery by Taskin, nice upright seam.

headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (Taskin Ahmed/Mushfiqur Rahim) 21 (35b 2x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: the bat was plonked inside but he lifted it even as both feet were in the air when the bails were dislodged. Excellent throw from deep point by Taskin, smart work from Mushfiqur. Very poor from Chandimal. Could have so easily just stretched back in. He was ambling down the crease this time. Bangladesh can't believe their luck. Third umpire S Ravi had a look at multiple replays, weighed his options and made the correct decision. Even though he was technically inside the crease, at the point of the bails coming off, both bat and feet were in the air. Rules state that is out.

dismissalText.commentary: Milinda Siriwardana run out (sub [Shuvagata Hom]/Mushfiqur Rahim) 12 (16b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: is that another run-out? Hesitation between the two batsmen. Yup, he's short. Second run-out of the innings. He is actually run out this time. Flat delivery outside off, tapped towards point. Siriwardana sets off, Mendis says yes and no. Siriwardana can't turn quick enough. Sold him down did Mendis. The throw is decent. Mushfiqur takes the throw in front of the stumps and removes the bails in one motion, even while withdrawing his hands to create time with momentum. Lovely work from Bangladesh there. The point fielder didn't muck up.

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Gunathilaka b MDK Perera 54 (62b 7x4 0x6) SR: 87.09

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib goes! With that, it seems Bangladesh's hopes are gone too. His back was clearly troubling him, but he took the easy way out. Didn't try and soldier through a tough period. Not very good from the experienced man. Full delivery on off, Shakib stays in his crease and nails a drive straight to Gunathilaka who takes the catch on a second attempt.

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz c Tharanga b Kulasekara 51 (71b 6x4 0x6) SR: 71.83

dismissalComment.html: slower delivery outside off, Mehedi takes it on the full but toe-ends it to the man at the edge of the ring at cover. Gutsy knock

leading edge back to Kulasekara. Dolly of a catch, really. Timed his jumped well and took the catch but lost the grip when he was trying to throw the ball up in delight. Grabbed it, swung it around and lost it while in the motion of throwing it up. Fair call in the end, Tamim shakes his head but has to walk off.

that really is a horror shot from Sabbir and he's paid the price. This had the width alright, he threw his hands at it with the feet going nowhere. All he managed was a thick edge that was pouched safely by Dinesh Chandimal, who moved swiftly to his right. Sri Lankans don't hold back in celebrating the wicket. The man with whom they've had a few tiffs in the series is gone.

this is a length ball on middle which Taskin looks to mow over wide long-on but ends up getting it on the top half of his bat, which means there's more elevation than distance. The man coming in from the boundary had enough time to stop, settle underneath, then again run forward to complete the catch on the move. Sri Lanka's first win in eight ODIs. Series ends 1-1

dismissalComment.html: and goes straight through Mosaddek. That's a really poor stroke. A flat delivery on middle, Mosaddek mistakes a short length for a bad delivery. And exposes his stumps in a bid to cut. The ball skids on with a bit of turn and beats his extravagant cut to hit the stumps. That's an awful stroke. No room to cut. Put pressure on himself by playing too many dot balls.

lured by the flight, looked to launch him over the ground but ended up hitting it flat to the bowler who took it right in front of his face on the followthrough. Had he missed, the ball would have hit him on the face. Wonder if he has dental insurance. Brings out the 'dab' celebration too. The resistance has ended.

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Lakmal 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: hit on the back pad by a delivery that nips back in to beat the inside edge. The only bone of contention was the height. At the point of impact, the ball didn't have much distance to travel. He was given out on the field, so the decision could have been overturned only if the ball would have completely missed the stumps. On this occasion, ball tracking indicates the ball would have clipped top of middle and so the umpire's call will stay. Sri Lanka are all over Bangladesh like a bad rash. The pacers are turning it on here at the SSC.

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar st Chandimal b MDK Perera 38 (44b 3x4 1x6) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: superb delivery from Dilruwan. Completely does Soumya in. Drift, and dip. Flat delivery outside off, the ball pitches and rips past the outside edge. Soumya's feet are nowhere, his momentum takes him forward and it's an easy stumping for Chandimal. Fantastic bowling. Almost a no-ball, but he has a smidgen behind.

commentPostTextItems.html: 6.00pm So Bangladesh will have to wait longer to record their first bilateral ODI series win over Sri Lanka. The difference tonight, I reckon, is that blistering half-century from Thisara Perera. Lifted Sri Lanka to 280 after two horrendous run outs. Then with the new ball, Suranga Lakmal and Nuwan Kulasekara were outstanding. The damage upfront gave enough cushion for the spinners even when Shakib and Soumya briefly threatened to take the game away from them through a fine counter-attack. The old adage of 'one brings two' held true again as Sri Lanka kept chipping away at the wickets to put this beyond the visitors. Credit to Mehedi for a gutsy half-century but he was simply delaying the inevitable. Over to the two T20Is on April 4 and 6 then to round-off what has been a cracking tour so far. Level in the Tests, Level in the ODIs.

"We lost the match in the first 10 overs, both with the bat and ball. 280 was definitely chaseable," says Mashrafe Mortaza. "There wasn't much pressure on us coming today. We've to sit together and come with plans for the next series in Ireland."
Kusal Mendis is the Player of the Series for scoring 160 runs, including a sublime century in the second ODI.
"Really happy with the way I'm batting," says Man of the Match Thisara Perera. "I'm returning to the side after six months. I've done well at training, I just want to keep this going."

commentTextItems.html: driven firmly to point as they scamper a single

dismissalText.commentary: Mehidy Hasan Miraz c Tharanga b Kulasekara 51 (71b 6x4 0x6) SR: 71.83

commentPreTextItems.html: Kulasekara is back. Light beginning to dip. Umpires aren't too perturbed though. Batsmen aren't complaining either. Why would they?

commentPreTextItems.html: walrus: "If only, if only... with how everything seems to be proceeding so far, would be interesting to see how the match would've panned out if BD took some of the key moments into their favour. But first things first, they've got to sort out their batting order, with the pinch hitting near the end, and the proper technically correct batsmen in Mossadek, Mahmudullah and Mehedi in the middle order. "

how's that for placement? There's point and short third man. But he manufactures some width by moving to the leg side, then unfurls his wrists to pick that gap between the two fielders. Solid timing too

dismissalComment.html: gone this time. Mustafizur strikes. It was going to be the last ball of his spell, but Mendis still sticks to an attempted dab to third man. dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal run out (Taskin Ahmed/Mushfiqur Rahim) 21 (35b 2x4 0x6) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: the bat was plonked inside but he lifted it even as both feet were in the air when the bails were dislodged. Excellent throw from deep point by Taskin, smart work from Mushfiqur. Very poor from Chandimal. Could have so easily just stretched back in. He was ambling down the crease this time. Bangladesh can't believe their luck. Third umpire S Ravi had a look at multiple replays, weighed his options and made the correct decision. Even though he was technically inside the crease, at the point of the bails coming off, both bat and feet were in the air. Rules state that is out.

dismissalText.commentary: Milinda Siriwardana run out (sub [Shuvagata Hom]/Mushfiqur Rahim) 12 (16b 1x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: is that another run-out? Hesitation between the two batsmen. Yup, he's short. Second run-out of the innings. He is actually run out this time. Flat delivery outside off, tapped towards point. Siriwardana sets off, Mendis says yes and no. Siriwardana can't turn quick enough. Sold him down did Mendis. The throw is decent. Mushfiqur takes the throw in front of the stumps and removes the bails in one motion, even while withdrawing his hands to create time with momentum. Lovely work from Bangladesh there. The point fielder didn't muck up.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c & b Kulasekara 4 (6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: leading edge back to Kulasekara. Dolly of a catch, really. Timed his jumped well and took the catch but lost the grip when he was trying to throw the ball up in delight. Grabbed it, swung it around and lost it while in the motion of throwing it up. Fair call in the end, Tamim shakes his head but has to walk off.

headshotImage.caption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar st Chandimal b MDK Perera 38 (44b 3x4 1x6) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: superb delivery from Dilruwan. Completely does Soumya in. Drift, and dip. Flat delivery outside off, the ball pitches and rips past the outside edge. Soumya's feet are nowhere, his momentum takes him forward and it's an easy stumping for Chandimal. Fantastic bowling. Almost a no-ball, but he has a smidgen behind.

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Chandimal b Kulasekara 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that really is a horror shot from Sabbir and he's paid the price. This had the width alright, he threw his hands at it with the feet going nowhere. All he managed was a thick edge that was pouched safely by Dinesh Chandimal, who moved swiftly to his right. Sri Lankans don't hold back in celebrating the wicket. The man with whom they've had a few tiffs in the series is gone.

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim lbw b Lakmal 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: hit on the back pad by a delivery that nips back in to beat the inside edge. The only bone of contention was the height. At the point of impact, the ball didn't have much distance to travel. He was given out on the field, so the decision could have been overturned only if the ball would have completely missed the stumps. On this occasion, ball tracking indicates the ball would have clipped top of middle and so the umpire's call will stay. Sri Lanka are all over Bangladesh like a bad rash. The pacers are turning it on here at the SSC.

headshotImage.caption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Danushka Gunathilaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Gunathilaka b MDK Perera 54 (62b 7x4 0x6) SR: 87.09

dismissalComment.html: and Shakib goes! With that, it seems Bangladesh's hopes are gone too. His back was clearly troubling him, but he took the easy way out. Didn't try and soldier through a tough period. Not very good from the experienced man. Full delivery on off, Shakib stays in his crease and nails a drive straight to Gunathilaka who takes the catch on a second attempt.

dismissalText.commentary: Mosaddek Hossain b Prasanna 9 (20b 0x4 0x6) SR: 45

dismissalComment.html: and goes straight through Mosaddek. That's a really poor stroke. A flat delivery on middle, Mosaddek mistakes a short length for a bad delivery. And exposes his stumps in a bid to cut. The ball skids on with a bit of turn and beats his extravagant cut to hit the stumps. That's an awful stroke. No room to cut. Put pressure on himself by playing too many dot balls.

dismissalComment.html: and gone. Mahmudullah perishes to a loose stroke. Bouncer down leg, Mahmudullah is through his pull too early and the ball kisses the glove on its way to the keeper. A golden chance for Mahmudullah to press his claim for a higher spot, but he's given it away. Bangladesh sink further

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c & b Prasanna 16 (23b 2x4 0x6) SR: 69.56

dismissalComment.html: lured by the flight, looked to launch him over the ground but ended up hitting it flat to the bowler who took it right in front of his face on the followthrough. Had he missed, the ball would have hit him on the face. Wonder if he has dental insurance. Brings out the 'dab' celebration too. The resistance has ended.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taskin Ahmed c Gunaratne b Kulasekara 14 (27b 1x4 0x6) SR: 51.85

dismissalComment.html: this is a length ball on middle which Taskin looks to mow over wide long-on but ends up getting it on the top half of his bat, which means there's more elevation than distance. The man coming in from the boundary had enough time to stop, settle underneath, then again run forward to complete the catch on the move. Sri Lanka's first win in eight ODIs. Series ends 1-1

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mustafizur Rahman not out 1 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: leading edge back to Kulasekara. Dolly of a catch, really. Timed his jumped well and took the catch but lost the grip when he was trying to throw the ball up in delight. Grabbed it, swung it around and lost it while in the motion of throwing it up. Fair call in the end, Tamim shakes his head but has to walk off.

that really is a horror shot from Sabbir and he's paid the price. This had the width alright, he threw his hands at it with the feet going nowhere. All he managed was a thick edge that was pouched safely by Dinesh Chandimal, who moved swiftly to his right. Sri Lankans don't hold back in celebrating the wicket. The man with whom they've had a few tiffs in the series is gone.

headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: hit on the back pad by a delivery that nips back in to beat the inside edge. The only bone of contention was the height. At the point of impact, the ball didn't have much distance to travel. He was given out on the field, so the decision could have been overturned only if the ball would have completely missed the stumps. On this occasion, ball tracking indicates the ball would have clipped top of middle and so the umpire's call will stay. Sri Lanka are all over Bangladesh like a bad rash. The pacers are turning it on here at the SSC.

and gone. Mahmudullah perishes to a loose stroke. Bouncer down leg, Mahmudullah is through his pull too early and the ball kisses the glove on its way to the keeper. A golden chance for Mahmudullah to press his claim for a higher spot, but he's given it away. Bangladesh sink further

headshotImage.longCaption: Dilruwan Perera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: superb delivery from Dilruwan. Completely does Soumya in. Drift, and dip. Flat delivery outside off, the ball pitches and rips past the outside edge. Soumya's feet are nowhere, his momentum takes him forward and it's an easy stumping for Chandimal. Fantastic bowling. Almost a no-ball, but he has a smidgen behind.

and Shakib goes! With that, it seems Bangladesh's hopes are gone too. His back was clearly troubling him, but he took the easy way out. Didn't try and soldier through a tough period. Not very good from the experienced man. Full delivery on off, Shakib stays in his crease and nails a drive straight to Gunathilaka who takes the catch on a second attempt.
